ai.summary: Channel to Channel is a demanding UK long-distance hike covering 135.4 km. The route traverses coastal paths, rugged moorlands, and varied terrain with significant elevation, demanding fitness, navigation, and careful planning.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain varies from exposed coastal paths and cliffs to rocky upland moorland, open grassy ascents, and woodland sections. Expect steep climbs, uneven footing, boggy stretches, and navigation-heavy sections. Weather can be changeable and wind exposure is common.
ai.safety_notes: Plan around tide times for coastal segments; carry a map, compass, and GPS, and know how to use them. Share your itinerary with someone and check-in. Monitor weather forecasts and be prepared for rapid changes; ensure sufficient daylight for each day. Carry enough water and food, a light source, emergency gear, and know how to summon help (phone signal may be limited in remote sections; in an emergency call 999).
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good ankle support
Breathable waterproof jacket and waterproof trousers
Layered clothing (base layer, fleece or insulating layer, outer shell)
Hat, gloves, and sun protection (cap, sunglasses, sunscreen)
Map and compass (with GPS as backup) and knowledge of navigation
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
First-aid kit tailored for remote hiking
Water container(s) with at least 2 liters capacity and water purification method
High-energy food and snacks; consider a lightweight stove if needed
Rucksack with waterproof cover and dry bags
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) with longer daylight and more stable weather; winter hikes require advanced skills and equipment.

seo.title: Channel to Channel — 135.4 km Hard UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover Channel to Channel, a challenging 135.4 km trek in the UK. Get route overview, terrain, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons for this demanding long-distance hike.
